opened_prs.title: fix:bug issue_173
opened_prs.body: A validation has been added that checks if the json parameter is true and the running server message appears only in JSON and when there is no json parameter the normal flow is followed.

labels.name: Request CLA
labels.description: Request the CLA bot to run and check if CLA is signed

opened_issues.title: Incorrect API mapping for bge-reranker-v2-m3 model
opened_issues.body:
Hi there,
I'm encountering an issue when using lm studio to start the API service. The bge-reranker-v2-m3 model is being mapped to the "/v1/embeddings" interface instead of the "/v1/rerank" interface. This is causing a problem for me as I'm unable to import the model in a rerank manner in Dify.

It would be great if you could consider adding the "/v1/rerank" API interface in future updates. This would greatly improve the functionality and compatibility of the model with different tools like Dify.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/6970f387-4f54-4cb4-836e-0f9bb77f0dd2)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/de80a9f7-c105-4b90-81d4-1a55dfad8608)

opened_issues.title: Locally downloaded models are deleted after updating the app
opened_issues.body: When upgrading from version 3.0.10 to 3.0.11, it was discovered that the upgrade of the application would cause local downloaded models to be lost, with the model address not being the default path.

opened_issues.title: Feature Request: Add a note box for the model cards
opened_issues.body:
I would like to see a simple Notes Box to write whatever one wants into the model card.
For example, this model works better with x temperature, or I chose this vision model for OCR not object recognition.

In this sense one has all the information within LMStudio, ready to serve.

Thank you.

opened_issues.title: Add support for Intel NPU
opened_issues.body: I have an Intel Ultra I saw you guys have a version for Snapdragon any chance we can add Intel NPU support?

opened_issues.title: would lms support rerank model and api
opened_issues.body:
as lms support text embedding model,would it go further to support rerank model and API

opened_issues.title: Feature Request: count tokens before calling '/v1/chat/completions'
opened_issues.body: Recently, we integrated Microsoft Word with LM Studio through a local Word Add-in. You can view a demo [here](https://gptlocalhost.com/demo/). We're planning to add a feature to count tokens before calling '/v1/chat/completions,' allowing users to see the remaining tokens available for inference. Our question is: Is it possible for LM Studio to count the tokens of the prompt before calling '/v1/chat/completions'? Thank you for any advice.

closed_issues.title: Support to identify accepted tokens when speculative decoding is enabled
closed_issues.body:
**Problem:** Currently, when using the API, it's difficult to identify whether the accepted tokens are generated through speculative decoding with a draft model. It would be helpful to have a way to track or flag when tokens are coming from speculative decoding so users can have more visibility and control over the model's output, especially when debugging or validating outputs.

**Request**: I would like to request the ability to identify whether tokens are generated by speculative decoding in the response when speculative decoding is enabled. Specifically, it would be useful if an additional flag or metadata field could be added to the API response to indicate that the token was generated by a draft model during speculative decoding.

**Possible implementation**:
Add a new field in the token response, such as is_speculative_decoding or generated_by_draft_model, which would return true or false.
Provide clear documentation on interpreting this field and when speculative decoding occurs. This would be a valuable addition to the model's API for users looking to better monitor and understand the underlying processes.

Thank you for considering this request.

wartime_milady_ceo_summary: - **Incorrect API Mapping Issue (#187):** Users reported that the `bge-reranker-v2-m3` model is incorrectly mapped to the `/v1/embeddings` interface instead of the `/v1/rerank` interface, causing issues with importing the model for reranking tasks in Dify. A request was made to add the `/v1/rerank` API interface in future updates for better functionality and compatibility.

- **Model Deletion on Update (#185):** An issue was identified where locally downloaded models are deleted when upgrading the application from version 3.0.10 to 3.0.11, particularly if the model path is not set to the default. This has raised concerns about data loss
